results.title: Pay for performance
results.brief_description: Summary: Saul Gellerman and Emanuel Kay discuss how to avoid negative effects of poorly understood pay policies, how to ensure maximum advantage from salaries and wages and goal setting as a replacement for traditional performance appraisal programs

results.title: Pay day
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Six of the best”.
All of the six school friends have found employment except Carl and Sal, who has found her way to the local government support drop in centre. Raises issues about relations with employers, assistance for the unemployed and peer groups. Follow on from “Passing out”. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Pay as you go
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Pay As You Go (PAYG) system, introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes information on PAYG withholding and PAYG instalments and the requirements for business. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: Pax Romana
results.brief_description:
Episode 7 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
In 52 BC, Julius Cesar defeats Vercingetorix and conquers Gaul. Soon the Pax Romana will expand to all of Europe and the British Isles. This episode presents an overview of Roman civilisation with a particular focus on civil and military engineering.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Paws
results.creator_credit: Karl Zwicky, Vicki Watson, Andrena Finlay, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Latent Image Productions, AFFC and PolyGram Film International
results.brief_description: Zac (Nathan Cavaleri) never wanted a dog, until he met a special dog called PC. PC’s master, Alex, is murdered by the evil associates of his ex wife, Anja. Anja and Alex used to live in Iceland where Alex wrote computer programs; the only problem was that Anja stole her husband’s programs and sold them. Alex managed to escape to Australia with 1 million dollars and PC. Before his death Alex attaches a computer disc to PC’s collar and sends him off to a friend. PC ends up in the care of her neighbour, Zac. Through the assistance of a computer which translates dog noises into a human voice, Zac and PC become quickly become friends as they try and avoid Anja and find the 1 million dollars before her. Also starring Norman Kaye, Sandy Gore, Caroline Gillmer, Emilie Francois and Billy Connolly as the voice of PC.

results.title: Pavor nocturnus
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An abstract narrative about dream flashbacks of a disturbing nature. A child survives a car accident in which his father was killed. He has contiinuing mental flashbacks and consequently this makes him fear death. He is bitten on the arm by a fly, and this begins a surreal experience of messages being relayed to him via the fly bites. A surreal thriller where confusion between the dream self and the real self is explored.

results.title: Pavlovsk
results.brief_description: A picturesque film that looks at the beautiful Pavlovsk House. There is very little narration in this film but it is accompanied with music by 18th and 19th century composers and performances by members of the Leningrad Ballet Theatre.

results.title: Pavlova
results.creator_credit: R.A. Weinberg, Micheline Charest and Pierre Morin
results.brief_description: Fifty years after her death, Anna Pavlova is still considered one of the greatest ballerinas of the 20th century. This film is a tribute to the great ballerina and recreates those works which have made her immortal such as “The Dying Swan”, “Californian Poppy”, “The Dragonfly”, “Coppelia”, and many more. Performed by members of L’Ecole Superieure de Danse du Quebec and leading ballet dancers. Rated: G

results.title: Pavarotti in London
results.brief_description: The magnificent Luciano Pavarotti performing at his best in a Gala Concert performance at the Royal Albert Hall on 13th April 1982 in the presence of Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, and featuring the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Kurt Herbert Adler. Recorded live on location.

results.title: Pavarotti in China: the Luciano Pavarotti Concert from the Exhibition Hall Theatre Beijing
results.brief_description: This is a live recording for television of Pavarotti’s concert performance in Beijing on June 24th 1986. This world renowned Italian singer once again presents a magnificent performance to an enthusiastic and appreciative audience, mixing popular Italian songs along with excerpts from some of the best known operas. Pavarotti is superbly supported by the Orchestra and Chorus of the Municipal Opera of Genoa with Dante Ghersi as choir master and Emerson Buckley as the conductor. Sung in Italian.
